content:
All, there was supposed to be an orientation for this track today:

When: Tuesday, September 04, 2018 11:00 AM-12:00 PM. (UTC-05:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada)
Where: GTM - Details Below

~~~~~~~~~
HL7 FHIR Connectathon Subscriptions Track Orientation Call
Mon, Sep 10, 2018 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM EDT

Please join my meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone.
https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/248421349

You can also dial in using your phone.
United States: +1 (646) 749-3112

Access Code: 248-421-349

First GoToMeeting? Let's do a quick system check:
https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check
However, due to some scheduling snafus, I don't think a notification went out for it...
If we get on and there aren't attendees, we'll get another date/time set up.
Well, even that text conflicts with itself. I think we'll just reschedule
good thing we all have a subscription to this stream

Ok let's try this again. If you signed up for the track in the survey, you should have received an invite for next Monday's orientation call! If not, and you're interested, we would love to see you on the call as well.

When: Monday, September 17, 2018 2:00 PM-3:00 PM. (UTC-05:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada)
Where: GTM - Details Below

~~~~~~~~~
FHIR Subscriptions Track Call
Mon, Sep 17, 2018 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM CDT

Please join my meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone.
https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/362502165

You can also dial in using your phone.
United States: +1 (571) 317-3122

Access Code: 362-502-165

First GoToMeeting? Let's do a quick system check:
https://link.gotomeeting.com/system-check
Reminder that our orientation call is in 23 minutes (13:00 America/Chicago)
Here is a link to the slides we reviewed today: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Qh8ZxVJ6aIelYhklz1y-agPXpzohc9MNiOVOIU_w4Sc/edit?usp=sharing
Hi everyone and welcome! If you haven't already, register as a participant of the Subscriptions track in the connectathon tool here: http://conman.fhir.org/connectathon.html?event=baltimore2018

So far, I'm tracking on a few topics/discussions that we've had:

  • What should servers do if the "authorization" determination is asynch, and the server won't know the subscription is error until later? The doc currently states that the request to create the subscription should return an operationOutcome if there's an error.

• While security around data is left outside of spec, it should probably be mentioned. EG: considerations about alerts that would allow someone to know there was sensitive data (subscribing to positive HIV results) and what the recommendations/concerns are around that

• More detail around the use of the Headers param for allowing the Subscriber to "protect" the notification URL with an Authorization token. It's in the examples, but hard to find doc around this as a solid recommendation
    ** In addition, if this is a go forward recommendation, considerations since the headers value can contain cryptographic secrets or other sensitive info that should not be stored in the clear?
    ** Just more doc around this in general
• Behavior of _list and other query parameters that reference changeable sets of data for a subscription? This is a subscription that changes dynamically.

Ok: all issues either have their own topic now or are logged as GForge trackers. The outcomes are summarized here for those interested: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=201809_FHIR_Subscriptions#Outcomes
